intro: Erodium × bolosii, commonly known as the Bolosii stormpetal, is a naturally occurring hybrid plant native to California. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and grasslands. It has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces fluffy, pale pink or white seed pods. Due to its limited distribution and hybrid origin, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
